III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/16/25, a youth was witnessed touching another youth on the
breast and vagina over the clothing. This has been happening
over a period of time. Both youth have developmental disabilities
and a sexual assault history. One youth has 2:1 staffing so it is
unknown how this is occurring.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/25.
Youth A reported she, Youth B and Youth E were sitting on the
floor together with a blanket over them, after Youth B brought her
blanket out to the milieu. Youth A reported Staff 3 told Youth B
she needed to put her blanket away in her room. Youth A reported
she never touched Youth B and Youth B never touched her. Youth
A reported she wasn’t sure where these allegations came from or
why anyone reported this information because nothing happened.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/25.
Youth D reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E had a blanket in
the milieu, but she’s not sure whose blanket it was. Youth D
reported the three youth were sitting in a row in the corner under
the TV in the milieu. Youth D reported the blanket was covering
their waists down to their toes. Youth D reported she wasn’t really
paying attention to them, but then she saw the blanket moving,
heard Youth B moaning, and Youth A and Youth E began
laughing. Youth D reported she didn’t see anything inappropriate
happen. Youth D reported Youth A, Youth B, and Youth E were
talking about sex when this happened, and she saw Youth B start
moving the blanket while she was moaning. Youth B reported she
thinks Youth B was touching herself but wasn’t sure if Youth B
was just pretending or was actually doing it. Youth D reported
there were no staff present in the milieu when this occurred. Youth
D reported she did not see Youth A touch Youth B inappropriately.
Youth D reported she went to “The Center” and when she got
back, the three youth were still under the blanket in the milieu.
Youth D reported the three youth asked her and Youth C to join
them under the blanket, but they both refused because they didn’t
feel comfortable. Youth D reported Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
2

and Youth D were bullying her all day on 3/16/25, so she was
frequently speaking to staff about it, and Youth A said she was
snitching, which increased their bullying. Youth D reported she
spent a lot of time with staff on 3/16/25 to stay away from the
bullying.
Attempts were made to interview Youth B, Youth C and Youth
E face to face at the facility on 3/21/25. All three youth refused
to be interviewed.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 3/21/25. Staff 1 reported
on 3/17/25 she was getting the youth ready to get on the bus for
school. Staff 1 reported she took Youth D out to the bus by
herself. Staff 1 reported Youth D disclosed Youth A was bullying
her on 3/16/25 and got the other youth to join in on bullying her
too, so it was a really bad day. Youth D disclosed she saw Youth
A under a blanket with Youth B and Youth E in the milieu. Youth D
reported staff were present and watching them. Youth D told Staff
1 she saw hand movements and tickling happening amongst the
youth under the blanket. Youth D told Staff 1 Youth E left and
eventually it was just Youth A and Youth B under the blanket, with
staff still supervising. Youth D told Staff 1 she saw Youth A touch
Youth B’s breasts while she was tickling her and saw Youth A
touch Youth B’s vagina as well. Youth D reported Youth C saw
this happen and made a face when it occurred. Youth E told Staff
1 Youth A was tickling her on the inside of her leg on 3/16/25, but
didn’t touch her inappropriately.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/25.
Staff 2 reported during 1st shift on 3/16/25, Youth B brought her
blanket out into the milieu and sat in one of the chairs. Supervisor
told Youth B to put the blanket back in her room. After a couple of
redirects, Youth B said she would comply if Staff 2 let her in her
room. Staff 2 reported she let Youth B in her room and Youth B
put her blanket away. Staff 2 reported no youth were under the
blanket with Youth B when she had it in the milieu during 1st shift.
Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B had a verbal argument
during 1st shift and were separated from each other most of the
shift as a result.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/21/25.
Staff 3 reported she worked 2nd shift on 3/16/25 with a guest staff
(Staff 4) and a part-time staff (Staff 5). Staff 3 reported she was
quite busy because she was the only full-time staff from the
program. Staff 3 reported most of the time, Staff 4 was cooking in
the kitchen, and Staff 5 was with various youth. Staff 3 reported
3

Youth B brought a blanket out to the milieu and refused to put it
back in her room despite being prompted many times. Staff 3
reported it was not a large blanket. Staff 3 reported Youth A,
Youth B, Youth C and Youth E were sitting in a circle in the milieu
and the blanket was over their knees. Staff 3 reported she told the
youth to take the blanket off them, but they refused. Staff 3
reported she went to pass out medications, so Staff 4 sat by the
youth to supervise them. Staff 3 reported after medications were
passed out, she again told the youth the blanket needed to be put
away. Staff 3 reported Youth A got in her face and said she was
going to “beat the shit out of her”. Youth B then agreed to remove
the blanket and got it off their legs. Staff 3 reported soon after,
Youth E got a blanket from her room, put it over her shoulders,
and laid on the floor with it covering her. Staff 3 reported Youth A
began tickling Youth E on her side while Youth B began tickling
Youth E on her feet. Staff 3 reported she told the youth it wasn’t
appropriate, and they needed to stop touching each other, so they
stopped. Staff 3 reported she never saw any of the girls touch
each other inappropriately under the blanket while she was
present, but Staff 4 was around them more when they had the
blanket. Staff 3 reported Staff 5 was with Youth D most of the time
because the other youth were bullying Youth D.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 3/28/25. Staff 4 reported
during the shift, he was sitting in the milieu with Youth A, Youth B,
Youth C, and Youth E. Staff 4 reported Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth E were sitting in a row against the wall under the TV and
they had a blanket covering their legs. Staff 4 reported the blanket
was a smaller child’s blanket. Staff 4 reported they were each
sitting 1-2 feet away from each other under the blanket, and the
blanket was only covering their legs, but no higher. Staff 4
reported the youths’ hands were above the blanket the entire time
he was in the milieu supervising them. Staff 4 reported Staff 3
repeatedly told the youth to put the blanket away, but they weren’t
listening. Staff 4 reported Youth A and Youth B finally put the
blanket away because they were sick of hearing Staff 3 tell them
to do so. Staff 4 reported Youth E then took a blanket and covered
herself with it. Staff 4 reported while Youth E was covered with the
blanket, she put her feet out and touched Youth B. Youth B
immediately said, “you’re not supposed to touch me!”. Staff 4
reported towards the end of the evening, Youth B sat down, and
Youth A said she heard Youth B had coins in her bra. Staff 4
reported Youth A went to reach for Youth A to get the coins, but
Youth B stepped back, and then Youth A also stepped back. Staff
4 reported they began bickering, but no one physically touched
each other during this interaction. Staff 4 reported there was no
4

time in the milieu where the youth were present with a blanket and
staff were not supervising them. Staff 4 reported there was a
moment when Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E were out
in the milieu sitting in chairs. Staff 4 reported he was in and out of
the kitchen while Staff 3 and Staff 5 were in the milieu with the
youth doing a foot spa with them. Staff 4 reported Youth A began
talking about having sex with a previous boyfriend and Youth B
made a couple of moaning sounds. Staff 4 reported he stopped
the conversation immediately. Staff 4 reported there was no
blanket in the milieu at the time and Youth D was not present.
Staff 4 reported Youth D never came to the kitchen to tell him the
other youth were under a blanket, or doing/saying anything wrong
or inappropriate.
Staff 5 was interviewed via phone on 4/7/25. Staff 5 reported
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth E were bullying Youth D
most of the day on 3/16/25. Staff 5 reported Youth D was isolating
herself from the other youth as a result. Staff 5 reported she tried
to spend most of the shift doing activities with Youth D to separate
her from the rest of the youth. Staff 5 reported she was not
present in the milieu when any youth had a blanket. Staff 5
reported she did not witness any youth under a blanket and did
not witness any youth touching each other inappropriately.
VIDEO FOOTAGE REVIEWED:
Consultant attempted to view video footage from 3/16/25.
However, the video camera facing the milieu area was broken by
a youth during a prior escalation and no footage could be
reviewed.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 3/19/25 authored by Staff 1 states
Youth D told Staff 1 she saw Youth A touching Youth B’s
breast and genitals over her clothes on Sunday 3/16/25.
• Email from Therapist dated 4/1/25 states Youth A denies
every touching a peer inappropriately. These acts were
witnessed by other peers in the milieu space, though only
one peer talked about what she saw.
• Youth A 1:1 request letters dated 12/9/24 and 3/11/25
authored by Therapist and Chief Administrator request 1:1
staffing for up to 12 hours per day 7 days per week based
on consideration of youth disposition, programming
schedules, school schedules and milieu climate.
5

• Youth B 2:1 request letter dated 12/27/24 authored by
Therapist and Chief Administrator requests 2:1 staffing for
up to 13 hours per day 7 days per week. 1:1 staffing is
being utilized on weekends from 7am-8pm. Extra staffing is
based on the consideration of youth disposition,
programming schedules, school schedules, and milieu
climate. Youth B 1:1 request letter dated 3/21/25 requests
1:1 staffing under the same terms instead of 2:1 staffing.
• Client Safety Procedure states at least one staff member is
to always remain within eyesight and earshot of youth.
Youth Are never to be left alone together in a communal
space (milieu, hallway, bathroom, etc.) without direct staff
supervision.
• Residential Staffing Ratio Procedure states direct care staff
are required to always maintain supervision of youth except
when youth are in their individual sleeping rooms or
bathrooms. Staff must complete a minimum of 25 hours of
training annually, including training on preventing,
detecting, and responding effectively to sexual abuse and
sexual harassment of youth.
• Staff 3 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 3 was most recently trained on
supervision requirements on 1/2/25.
• Staff 4 does not have any disciplinary records in his
employee file. Staff 4 was trained on supervision
requirements during onboarding in February 2025.
• Staff 5 does not have any disciplinary records in her
employee file. Staff 5 was trained on supervision
requirements during shadow shifts in May & June 2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews conducted
and documentation reviewed, there is no information to support
these allegations occurred. Youth A denied the allegations, and
Youth D is the only person who voiced a concern. Youth D
originally told Staff 1 she saw Youth A touch Youth B
inappropriately. However, when Youth D was interviewed during
this investigation, she stated she never saw Youth A touch Youth
B inappropriately. Staff 3, Staff 4 and Staff 5 were working when
this incident allegedly occurred and none of them corroborate
Youth D’s account of the events in the milieu.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
